item.title: By: Where can I watch the Apple event live? | Deemable Tech
item.dc:creator: Where can I watch the Apple event live? | Deemable Tech
item.description: [...] discussed the reason why Apple didn’t allow or provide live streaming of its events in the past, but this change brings up new questions. Why now did Apple decide to provide a live video stream? [...]
item.content:encoded: […] discussed the reason why Apple didn’t allow or provide live streaming of its events in the past, but this change brings up new questions. Why now did Apple decide to provide a live video stream? […]

item.title: By: Want to watch the Apple iPad 3 event live? Good luck! | Deemable Tech
item.dc:creator: Want to watch the Apple iPad 3 event live? Good luck! | Deemable Tech
item.description: [...] Apple is holding at the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco. Unfortunately, just like the last Apple press event, the one thing that they will most likely not find is a live video stream of the Apple iPad [...]
item.content:encoded: […] Apple is holding at the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco. Unfortunately, just like the last Apple press event, the one thing that they will most likely not find is a live video stream of the Apple iPad […]

item.title: By: Ray Hollister
item.dc:creator: Ray Hollister
item.description: Here's a list of a few sites that will be live blogging the event: <a href="http://news.cnet.com/8301-13579_3-20114388-37/apples-iphone-event-plus-buzz-out-loud-join-us-tuesday-live-blog/" rel="nofollow">CNET</a>,<a href="http://www.zdnet.com/blog/hardware/apples-lets-talk-iphone-event-live-analysis/15086" rel="nofollow">ZDNet</a>, <a href="http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/03/apples-lets-talk-iphone-event-is-tomorrow-get-your-livebl/" rel="nofollow">Engadget</a>, <a href="http://live.slashgear.com/" rel="nofollow">Slashgear</a>, <a href="http://www.macworld.com/article/162575/2011/10/live_update.html" rel="nofollow">Macworld,</a> <a href="http://www.macnn.com/live/" rel="nofollow">Electronista</a>,<a href="http://www.tuaw.com/2011/10/04/tuaw-meta-liveblog-of-the-apple-lets-talk-iphone-event/" rel="nofollow">TUAW</a> and surprisingly <a href="http://live.gizmodo.com/" rel="nofollow">Gizmodo</a>.
item.content:encoded:
Here’s a list of a few sites that will be live blogging the event:
CNET,ZDNet, Engadget, Slashgear, Macworld, Electronista,TUAW and surprisingly Gizmodo.

item.title: By: Ray Hollister
item.dc:creator: Ray Hollister
item.description: <a href="http://www.watchvertex.com/" rel="nofollow">Vertex</a>, has said that they will be having a live broadcast and they will try to patch into the keynote room live, but they do not know if they will have video or only audio. Sounds like they are not exactly <em>officially</em> broadcasting the event, but they are going to try to hack their way in. If it goes well, I expect they'll never get invited to another Apple event. If it goes horribly, I expect they'll be served a restraining order!
item.content:encoded:
Vertex, has said that they will be having a live broadcast and they will try to patch into the keynote room live, but they do not know if they will have video or only audio. Sounds like they are not exactly officially broadcasting the
event, but they are going to try to hack their way in. If it goes well, I expect they’ll never get invited to another Apple event. If it goes horribly, I expect they’ll be served a restraining order!
